## **Getting Started**

---

### **üì• Prerequisites**
Download and install R first and then RStudio through the following link, if you haven't yet:

- **[R](https://cran.rstudio.com/)**
- **[RStudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)**

---

### **üìÇ Dataset & Materials**
- Open RStudio, create a new folder (name it e.g., "RStudio_workshop")
- Download the .Rmd files from the following link:
  - **[demo_script](https://github.com/mtrauernicht/RStudio_workshop/blob/main/demo.Rmd)**
  - **[exercise_script](https://github.com/mtrauernicht/RStudio_workshop/blob/main/exercises.Rmd)**
- Place the downloaded files in the folder you created.
- The .csv files can be either also downloaded from the repository, or loaded directly from GitHub into RStudio (see demo.Rmd for explanation)
- If you have a GitHub account and git set up on your local device, you can instead of downloading the data also clone the repository to your local machine using the following commands:
```
cd /path/to/your/folder
git clone https://github.com/mtrauernicht/RStudio_workshop.git
```

## **Additional Tips & Tricks**  

#### **RStudio Shortcuts & Essentials**  
- **Get function help** ‚Üí Type `?function` in the console (e.g., `?read.csv`).
- **Run a single line** ‚Üí Press **`Cmd + Enter`** (Mac) or **`Ctrl + Enter`** (Windows/Linux).  
- **Run an entire block** ‚Üí Press **`Cmd + Shift + Enter`** (Mac) or **`Ctrl + Shift + Enter`** (Windows/Linux).  
- **Comment/Uncomment lines** ‚Üí Select lines and press **`Cmd + Shift + C`** (Mac) or **`Ctrl + Shift + C`** (Windows/Linux).  
- **Auto-indent selected code** ‚Üí Press **`Cmd + Shift + I`** (Mac) or **`Ctrl + Shift + I`** (Windows/Linux).  
- **Open a data frame directly from within the code** ‚Üí Press **`Cmd + Click`** (Mac) or **`Ctrl + Click`** (Windows) on the object.

### **Speed up coding with GitHub Copilot**  
GitHub Copilot can assist with code suggestions and completions:  
1. Go to **`Tools` > `Global Options` > `Copilot`**.  
2. Install GitHub Copilot.  
3. Sign in to your GitHub account.  
   - **‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** You need a **GitHub Pro account**, but it‚Äôs **free for students** via [GitHub Education](https://education.github.com/).  

### üîó **Link RStudio Project to a GitHub Repository**  
Easily manage your code with version control:  
1. **Create a repository on GitHub** ([GitHub Repo Creation](https://github.com/new)).  
2. In RStudio, click **`New Project`** (top-right corner).  
3. Select **`Version Control`** ‚Üí **`Git`**.  
4. Paste the **GitHub repository URL** and **create the project**.
